column6: died of a cardiorespiratory attack during an attempt to enter the Spanish enclave of Melilla
column7: Un nuevo asalto a la valla de Melilla se ha saldado con un inmigrante fallecido y alrededor de 40 subsaharianos que han conseguido traspasar la frontera de un total de 125 que lo han intentado pasada la medianoche. El delegado del Gobierno, Abdelmalik El Barkani, ha explicado que el inmigrante fallecido, de unos 30 años, fue hallado sobre las 2:00 horas por un agente de la Guardia Civil en la zona conocida como Vaguada de Linares. Según las primeras hipótesis, el subsahariano pudo haber fallecido tras una parada cardiorrespiratoria, ya que no existe ningún signo de violencia, tras saltar la valla que separa la ciudad autónoma de Marruecos. Este subsahariano formaría parte del grupo de unos 40 inmigrantes que pasadas las 00:15 horas consiguió traspasar el vallado.Tras esta entrada, a lo largo de la madrugada, sobre las 5:30 horas, se ha producido el avistamiento y acercamiento de un nuevo grupo de subsaharianos, compuesto por unas 300 personas, que han sido contenidas y repelidas por el fuerte dispositivo policial establecido tanto en el lado español como en el marroquí. La nueva entrada es la tercera que se produce de manera consecutiva desde el pasado martes, por lo que la presión migratoria en estos momentos sobre Melilla es extrema.El pasado lunes 22 ya se produjo un avistamiento de unos 100 indocumentados, que intentaron acercarse al vallado, pero que no protagonizaron ningún salto. Al día siguiente, 23, se produjeron sobre las 5:00 horas dos asaltos simultáneos efectuados por más de 500 inmigrantes, de los que unos 130, según las últimas cifras, accedieron a la ciudad, 20 de los cuales fueron atendidos de heridas, en su mayoría leves, a excepción de uno que presentaba roturas en ambas muñecas. Además, ese mismo día cinco guardias civiles tuvieron también que ser atendidos, uno de los cuales ha sido dado de baja en el servicio.

column6: committed suicice out of fear of deportation from Brussels
column7: Samiyou Djimadou, a 29 year old asylum seeker who arrived in Belgium in September 2012, committed suicide on Monday after fearing deportation to his country of origin, and possible torture and death, reports dhnet.be.Asyluim claims in Belgium are supposed to be looked at within 6 months but after 10 months Samiyou’s claim had still not been examined.A friend of Samiyou’s  told denet.be that Samiyou had been suffering from insomnia though fear of being detained and deported.On Monday afternoon in Nerder-over-Heembeek in the north of Brussels, Samiyou decided to end his life. He firstly tried to throw himself under a lorry but the driver managed to avoid him, so he jumped into a canal next to the road.

column6: drowned at sea, clinging to tuna cage, while attempting to reach Italy
column7: Seven immigrants drown during attempt to cross into Italy holding on to tuna cagePosted Mon 17 Jun 2013, 5:42am AESTMAP: ItalySeven people have drowned while attempting to cross into Italy by gripping on to a large tuna fishing cage being towed by a trawler, witnesses say.Italy's coast guard rescued the migrants off the shores of Sicily after reports came in of dozens of people clinging desperately to the tuna cage out at sea.Survivors later told rescue workers seven people with them had drowned after trying to board the trawler when the crew cut the line linking the boat with the cage.Witnesses said the victims had been pushed back into the sea, Italian media said.

column6: died during childbirth on boat between Turkey and Italy; newborn survived
column7: REGGIO CALABRIA - A far capire come era andata sono stati i silenzi più che le parole. Gli occhi bassi dei migranti hanno raccontato ai loro soccorritori la tragedia nella tragedia. La neonata partorita durante il viaggio in mare tra la costa turca e quella di Roccella Jonica, nella Locride, sta bene. Ma della sua mamma non c'è traccia. Gli investigatori sono convinti che sia morta dandola alla luce, o immediatamente dopo. E che i suoi compagni di viaggio ne abbiano abbandonato il corpo al mare. La piccola si chiama Nojian - che significa "nuova vita" - le sue condizioni di salute sono confortanti. I medici dell'ospedale di Locri dicono che fisicamente è a posto: "due chili di gioia. Reagisce bene la piccina". Quando ieri sera il barcone di legno è stato avvistato a largo delle coste calabresi è immediatamente scattata la macchina dei soccorsi che lungo la costa jonica è ormai rodata. Le motovedette della Capitaneria di Porto hanno scortato la carretta che a malapena stava a galla al porto di Roccella. Qui è stata notata la piccola nata evidentemente da pochi giorni, era in grembo a una giovane donna con il ventre ancora rigonfio. Per questo i soccorritori hanno pensato che si trattasse della madre. Trasferite entrambe in ospedale per i controlli, al reparto di ginecologia la donna è risultata però incinta. Non era lei la madre, nè lo era una tra le altre quattordici donne sbarcate nel corso della notte. Secondo la prima ricostruzione degli investigatori, durante il viaggio durato  6 o 7 giorni, la bambina è stata data alla luce sull'imbarcazione da un'altra donna. La madre sarebbe morta durante il parto e nelle ore successive. Sarebbero stati gli altri compagni di viaggio ad affidare il suo corpo a Mediterraneo non potendo fare altro. Al momento, nonostante i silenzi dei 161 clandestini non c'è altra spiegazione.A bordo del vecchio barcone malandato i migranti erano stipati in non più di 20 metri, in condizioni disumane. Hanno viaggiato per giorni protetti, durante il giorno e la notte, soltanto da un grande telone di plastica nera. Una tettoia di fortuna sotto la quale è nata la piccola. Il gruppo era in gran parte formato da uomini adulti, insieme a loro 15 donne e 20 minori di diverse nazionalità. All'anagrafe dei soccorritori hanno detto di essere siriani, afghani, egiziani e pachistani. Alcuni di loro hanno intrapreso un lungo viaggio attraversando diversi paesi per raggiungere la costa turca, da qui l'ultimo tratto per superare il Mediterraneo. Ad alcuni chilometri dalla costa l'imbarcazione è stata intercettata dai mezzi della Capitaneria che l'hanno agganciata e portata fino al porto. Qui forze dell'ordine e volontari hanno lavorato tutta la notte per soccorrere i migranti maggiormente provati dai giorni trascorsi in mare senza cibo e con pochissima acqua. Per quattro di loro è stato necessario il ricovero in ospedale, ma anche le loro condizioni non sono preoccupanti.

column6: jumped out of window in Florence (IT) after asylum application was rejected
column7: Florence, June 13 - A 31-year-old man from Somalia who committed suicide in Florence on Thursday had recently been refused asylum by Italian authorities, the city's head of the Somalian community, Osman Gaal, said.

column6: tortured to death in Chechnya after Norway forced him to return to Russia
column7: On 17 December 2015, the Norwegian magazine Ny Tid reported that two rejected Chechen asylum seekers who were repatriated in spite of strong and serious warnings that they would be maltreated and tortured, had been murdered under atrociously cruel circumstances, especially Apti NAZJUJEV....Both the Norwegian Helsinki Committee and the Russian human rights group Memorial issued strong warnings to the Norwegian authorities not to send the two men to either Russia or Chechnya.Essentially, the reasoning of the Norwegian authorities was that whilst they were prepared to accept that the two men were not safe in Chechnya, they could make use of the internal flight alternative, for example by remaining in Moscow.Mr NAZYUYEV arrived in Norway and applied for asylum in 2008. As his application was turned down and he had exhausted all channels of appeal, he left Norway in 2011.On 18 May 2013, he was reported missing by his family, and on 10 June 2013, his decomposing body with numerous signs of torture was found in a river in Kali municipality in Chechnya.According to the autopsy report seen by Ny Tid, his teeth and fingernails had been pulled out, his skull had been broken, as well as his kneecap, and there were deep puncture wounds on his body.The Norwegian Immigration Appeals Board have seen the autopsy report and have accepted its authenticity....Commenting on these two cases on behalf of the Norwegian Immigration authorities (UDI), Torgeir TOFTE JøRGENSEN of the Immigraton Appeals Board (UNE) defended the decisions to deny both men asylum in Norway.‘’We believe that the decisions made were correct. One was heard by three judicial bodies where everyone agreed with the UNE. One of them was sent to Moscow, and we thought that it was dangerous for him to travel to Chechnya. He travelled on his own to Chechnya.’’...Mr NAZJUJEV has a sister who lives in Sweden and she has firmly rejected the UNE’s claim that her brother had travelled voluntarily to Chechnya.According to her, after his arrival in Moscow, he was ordered to go to Chechnya or else his family there would be tortured and killed.The Russian authorities had told him that he would not be allowed to remain in Moscow and he had the choice of either going to Chechnya ‘’voluntarily’’ or by force.The sister also said that her brother chose voluntary repatriation to Moscow because the Norwegian authorities had informed him that he would get no financial assistance if they expelled him by force.

column6: drowned after boat sank in the Aegean Sea; 9 rescued
column7: A refugee boat has sunk in the Aegean Sea off Ayvalık, leaving an Afghan refugee dead and five others missing. The deceased refugee was identified as 45-year-old Vahide Selami.Nine refugees were reportedly rescued after the incident.The boat was cruising south from Çıplak Island (Chalkis, Cimno) in the northwestern province of Balıkesir at 5 a.m. before sinking due to an unknown reason.Coast guard rescue teams are continuing their work to find the missing five.

column6: reportedly drowned after boat sank in Aegean Sea off the coast of Ayvalik (TR); 9 rescued
column7: A refugee boat has sunk in the Aegean Sea off Ayvalık, leaving an Afghan refugee dead and five others missing. The deceased refugee was identified as 45-year-old Vahide Selami.Nine refugees were reportedly rescued after the incident.The boat was cruising south from Çıplak Island (Chalkis, Cimno) in the northwestern province of Balıkesir at 5 a.m. before sinking due to an unknown reason.Coast guard rescue teams are continuing their work to find the missing five.

column6: stowaway, frozen to death on charter flight from Russia, flew 7 flights before discovery
column7: On the 6th of June the body of a young man carrying a Georgian Passport was discovered on an i-Fly charter flight after it landed at Moscow’s Vnukovo Airport. Maintenance workers spotted blood stains on one of the main landing gear struts, raising the alarm.It is suspected the deceased flew in the wheel well on at least seven flights before being discovered as an autopsy reveals he froze to death four days previously. Despite this it remains unknown where he initially boarded the flight.

column6: stabbed by her boyfriend, she was on leave from Lyng refugee centre (Norway)
column7: Året etter, i juni 2013, ble 17 år gamle Fahezeh Ahmadi fra Afghanistan knivstukket og drept av sin kjæreste. Ahmadi var da på permisjon fra Lyng statlige asylmottak.

column6: died due to lack of medical care of chronic asthma (DE)
column7: Der nigerianische Flüchtling Adams Bagna stirbt am 30.5.2013. Die Todesursache ist bisher ungeklärt. Können schlechte Unterbringung und mangelnde Versorgung von chronischem Asthma als wesentliche Gründe herangezogen werden? Nach dem bisher ungeklärten Tod von Cosmo Saizon in Bitterfeld machten Organisationen wie der Flüchtlingsrat und das Antirassistische Netzwerk erneut auf eine mangelnde Gesundheitsversorgung von Flüchtlingen aufmerksam ( http://www.mz-web.de/bitterfeld/bitterfeld-fluechtlingsrat-fordert-aufklaerung,20640916,22697066.html ). Die Vorwürfe einer unzureichenden medizinischen Versorgung wiesen politische Akteure genannt sei hier Bernhard Böddeker, Dezernent für Sicherheit, Ordnung und Kommunales und stellvertretender Landrat im Landkreis Anhalt-Bitterfeld, als unbegründet zurück ( http://www.mz-web.de/bitterfeld/fluechtlinge-in-anhalt-bitterfeld--konflikte-entladen-sich-,20640916,22729000.html). Nun erhärtet ein weiterer Todesfall eines Flüchtlings in Bernburg die massive Kritik der Organisationen an der gesundheitsgefährdenden Unterbringung sowie der mangelhaften Gesundheitsversorgung.Adams Bagna, ein Flüchtling aus Nigeria, starb am 30.5.2013. Er lebte in der Gemeinschaftsunterkunft Bernburg und litt an chronischem Asthma. Er soll aufgrund akuter Atemnot aus dem Zimmer gegangen und auf dem Flur zusammengebrochen sein, so berichteten Mitbewohner. Ein Reanimationsversuch des Rettungsdienstes blieb erfolglos. Die genaue Todesursache wird noch ermittelt, heisst es.

column6: committed suicide in refugee camp in Eisenhüttenstadt (DE)
column7: 28th of May 2013 a young man from Chad took his life in the refugee lager of Eisenhüttenstadt (Brandenburg/Germany)

column6: drowned after boat capsized off the coast of Morocco on the way to Spain; 7 rescued
column7: At least five illegal migrants drowned off the coast of northern Morocco as they were attempting to reach Spain, the Moroccan authorities said.The rescue services were alerted to the presence of a "polyester boat with a group of illegal immigrants on board that was in difficulty off the Marchica lagoon, in Nador province," local authorities were quoted as saying late on Monday by the official MAP news agency.They arrived at the scene and recovered five bodies, all male, while managing to save seven of the passengers, including four women, who were taken to hospital in Nador for treatment.

column6: drowned after small boat sank off coast of Farmakonisi (GR)
column7: A 6-year-old girl drowned when a small boat crammed with immigrants trying to enter Greece illegally sank off an eastern Aegean Sea islet. The Shipping and Aegean Ministry says 21 people, mainly Syrians, were rescued after the vessel foundered for unknown reasons on Wednesday off Farmakonisi. The nationality of the drowned child was not available. Uninhabited Farmakonisi, just off the Turkish coast, is regularly used by human trafficking rings to drop off people who pay them handsomely to be clandestinely taken into Greece.  (15.05.2013) EnetEnglish

column6: committed suicide in Zurich (Switzerland) out of despair over pending deportation
column7: on May 2, Tunisian Moncef S. committed suicide a week before his 26th birthday. Moncef was threatened with immediate deportation after the authorities had rejected his request for asylum. The border police arrested him in the middle of March. In an airport prison Moncef attempted suicide for the first time. He was then taken to a psychiatric ward, from which he fled at the beginning of May. On May 2 he was found dead in the cellar of his former apartment.

column6: died of heroin overdose in asylum centre in Schonefeld Ost (DE), body found 6 weeks later
column7: In einem Leipziger Asylbewerberheim hat ein Mann sechs Wochen lang tot in seinem Zimmer gelegen, ohne dass die Heimleitung darauf aufmerksam wurde. Das haben Recherchen des MDR-Nachrichtenmagazins "Exakt" ergeben. Dem Magazin liegen Dokumente vor, wonach der aus dem Libanon stammende Hashim Yasbek aus Beirut bereits Anfang Mai dieses Jahres im Asylbewerberheim Schönefeld Ost verstorben war. Todesursache war nach Angaben der Staatsanwaltschaft eine Überdosis eines Heroingemischs - der 34-Jährige soll schon länger als Drogenkonsument bekannt gewesen sein. Entdeckt wurde seine Leiche aber erst am 13. Juni. Bewohner des Heims hatten mehrfach auf die starke Geruchsbildung und Fliegenschwärme im Haus hingewiesen.

column6: died in Bitterfeld (DE) due to lack of medical care
column7: Am 25.04.13 verstarb Cosmo Saizon im Krankenhaus Bitterfeld, nachdem seine gesundheitlichen Beschwerden zunächst nicht ernst genommen wurden.Cosmo Saizon flüchtete aus Benin und befand sich seit September 2012 in der ZAST Halberstadt. Nach dem Aufenthalt in der ZAST bekam er seinen Transfer in die abgelegene Gemeinschaftsunterkunft in Friedersdorf. Über die desolaten Zustände in der Gemeinschaftsunterkunft in Friedersdorf und den Protest der Bewohner_innen gegen die Heimleitung wurde bereits gestern, am 30.04.2013 in der MZ berichtet. Der Todesfall von Cosmo Saizon verdeutlicht, dass die Gesundheit der Bewohner_innen dort erheblich gefährdet ist.

column6: died of tuberculosis after being denied medical care in hospital in Mallorca (ES)
column7: Spain’s treatment of its undocumented immigrant community has come under fire again following the death of a Senegalese man who was refused treatment at a hospital on the island of Majorca.Alpha Pam, 28, who had lived on Majorca for eight years, perished from tuberculosis in late April after the Comarca de Inca Hospital repeatedly refused to treat him because he did not have a Spanish health card. Tuberculosis is a deadly, but easily treatable, disease.

column6: 10 drowned, 13 missing after boat sank off Alhucemas Islands (Morocco/Spain), 24 rescued
column7: On 18 April 2013, the Moroccan authorities reported that they had rescued 24 sub-Saharan migrants and recovered 10 bodies from the sea, off the Alhucemas islands whose sovereignty is claimed by Spain.The Spanish authorities believe that the survivors and the known dead were among the 47 sub-Saharans on board a boat which ran into difficulties shortly after departing from the Moroccan coast on the early hours of 15 April 2013.It is not known what happened to the other 13 migrants, most if not all of whom had probably perished in the tragedy.

column6: died on the way to the hospital in Tarifa (ES) after being rescued with 14 others
column7: An ailing would-be immigrant died while 14 other illegal immigrants were rescued as they tried to make landfall on Spain’s southern shore, the Spanish coastguard said Wednesday.The coastguard dispatched a boat to assist the migrants who were approaching the coast on two boats, and then ordered a helicopter to transport one of the passengers who was in poor health to hospital.“Health services certified his death,” the Spanish coastguard later said in a statement, without giving further details.The remaining 14 migrants were given blankets and transported by boat to the port of Tarifa in the Spanish province of Cadiz which is located across the Strait of Gibraltar facing Morocco.Spanish police then took them to a detention centre for undocumented migrants.

column6: suicide in Arodes (CY) after his cries of concern over his wife and 4 children were ignored
column7: REFUGEE who left behind his wife and four children in Syria was driven to suicide on Wednesday, in what migrant support group KISA said was just another example of the inability of Cypriot authorities to respond to desperate calls for help.Mohammed, a Kurdish resident of Syria, fled from Syrian authorities and sought asylum in Cyprus some three months ago. He lived in the Paphos village of Arodes and was given the run-around by the labour office and the social welfare department, KISA said.“What seems to have led the unfortunate refugee to suicide was the heartlessness to which Cypriot authorities responded to his desperate call for help, but also his intense worry for his life and his family’s fate,” KISA said.Asylum seekers do not have access to the labour market for the first six months of their stay in Cyprus, but are instead entitled to benefits, according to KISA’s information guide to asylum seekers. After six months in the country, they are allowed to work in farming and agriculture.But KISA said some people have to wait for months to receive benefits payments because of Parliament’s “racist decision” to examine the list of refugees receiving benefits, including those whose asylum applications have been accepted.The migrant support group said Mohammed’s suicide was indicative of the situation for refugees and asylum seekers in Cyprus, especially the Syrians who are often forced to flee their country and “are the most vulnerable of all social groups in (Cyprus)”.The state is making it increasingly hard for people to obtain asylum in Cyprus, KISA said, claiming that the authorities try in various ways, not all of them legal, to prevent assigning people with asylum status.People such as Mohammed become isolated, humiliated, and desperate, KISA said.- See more at: http://kisa.org.cy/kisa-says-refugee-was-driven-to-suicide/#sthash.Uk8TV76X.dpuf

column6: 10 drowned, 1 died on way to hospital, after boat capsized near Hoceima (MA); 23 rescued
column7: Eleven migrants trying to reach Europe died after their boat capsized off the north coast of Morocco, medical sources and a human rights group said on Wednesday.Of the 34 people travelling in the boat, reached up by the Moroccan navy at midday on Tuesday, two children, three women and six men died, and another 12 were hospitalised, a doctor in the coastal town of Hoceima told AFP.All but one of the victims drowned, the other dying while being transported to Hoceima hospital, according to Faisal Oussard, local representative for the Moroccan Association of Human Rights.They were all sub-Saharan migrants but their nationalities were not known.Oussard said the boat capsized nine kilometres (six miles) off Hoceima, having set off from Nador, 130 kilometres to the east, either headed for the north African Spanish enclave of Melilla, or mainland Spain.The sea was calm when the accident took place, but the boat, a rigid inflatable, or RIB, was far too small for the number of people it was carrying, he added.The condition of those those hospitalised in Hoceima and the fate of the 11 people who escaped without injury were not known.The Moroccan authorities frequently expel sub-Saharan migrants across the Algerian border, which is their main point of entry.Medical aid group Doctors Without Borders said last month that it was closing its projects in Morocco in protest at the plight of African migrants allegedly abused by Spanish and Moroccan police while trying to reach Europe.Thousands of illegal African migrants regularly attempt to cross from Morocco into Spain each year on overcrowded and makeshift boats.The tiny Spanish enclaves of Ceuta and Melilla, perched on the coast of north Africa and both claimed by Morocco, are key launching pads for clandestine migration to Europe.Melilla received 2,224 illegal immigrants last year, 262 more than in 2011, according to Spain’s Interior Minister Jorge Fernandez Diaz.He blamed instability in Africa’s Sahel region, and especially in Mali, for the rise in illegal immigrants trying to enter the territory.Local associations estimate that Morocco was hosting between 20,000 and 25,000 migrants from sub-Saharan countries in 2012 hoping for access to Europe through Spain.

column6: died on a boat that had been drifting in Mediterranean Sea near Zawiyah (LY); 89 rescued
column7: (Reuters) - Libya's coastguard has rescued 89 sub-Saharan African migrants who had been drifting in a boat for five days and had to dump the bodies of five people who died on the journey overboard, the state news agency said on Saturday.

column6: died of hypothermia after being rescued by Italian coast guard
column7: 88 migrants from Northern Africa were rescued on 30 March 2013 by coast guards near the island of Lampedusa who tried to reach the Sicilian Coast on a 10-meter dinghy. Two subsequently died from hypothermia. A public prosecutor of Agrigento started an inquiry to investigate the case. Mauro Casinghini, National Director of the Order of Malta’s Italian Rescue Corps (CISOM), blamed the absence of first aid on the coast guard boat for the death. He said that the Order of Malta was in charge to guarantee the presence of two doctors on each border patrol boat until March 2011, when the Italian government refused to renew the assistance agreement. Meanwhile, the island of Lampedusa again faces issues with over-crowding. In the last week alone, more than 800 immigrants reached the island.

column6: died, just hours after being released from removal centre in poor health conditions (GB)
column7: The Home Office has launched an investigation into the case of an asylum seeker who died within hours of being discharged from an immigration removal centre (IRC) where he had been held for three months.The day before Khalid Shahzad, 52, was released he had collapsed and was judged unfit to be detained because of his poor health, but officials at Colnbrook IRC decided to let him travel unaccompanied. He died en route from Euston station to Manchester on 30 March.The Pakistani national had been held at the centre, which is near Heathrow airport and operated by Serco. He had been issued with removal directions to Pakistan.The Guardian has learned Shahzad suffered cardiac problems and had an artificial heart valve fitted prior to his arrest. He collapsed twice at the centre and was taken to hospital. Detainees at Colnbrook say he was told he did not have long to live.On the day of his death he was discharged from custody after being deemed unfit for detention. He was given a travel warrant and travelled alone to Euston station where he boarded a train for Manchester. British transport police were called to the train at Wilmslow, Cheshire, where he was pronounced dead.The Guardian has spoken to detainees at Colnbrook. One said Shahzad suffered from constant breathing difficulties during his time at the centre.

column6: went missing, after boat sank near Tarifa (ES); 8 rescued
column7: Efectivos de Salvamento Marítimo buscan desde primeras horas de esta mañana a dos inmigrantes indocumentados de origen subsanaríamos (un varón y una mujer) que se encuentran desaparecidos tras hundirse la pequeña embarcación hinchable de juguete en la que viajaban junto a otras ocho personas. Siete de ellas han sido rescatadas por la embarcación de Salvamento Salvamar Alkaid que se encargó de su traslado al puerto de Tarifa (Cádiz). Otra persona qfue rescatada por una patrullera de la gendarmería marroquí.Según fuentes de Salvamento Marítimo, el naufragio se ha producido a las 7:15 horas en aguas próximas a la costa de Tánger (Marruecos). Aunque en principio se dio por muerto a uno de los inmigrantes, la tripulación de la embarcación de salvamento que rescató a los siete supervivientes logró reanimarlo y lo trasladó de urgencia hasta el Hospital Punta Europa de Algeciras (Cádiz). Fuentes hospitalarias aseguran que el joven subsahariano, de unos 20 años, ingresó con hipotermia severa y sobreoxigenación, por las que ha tenido que ser estabilizado.Mientras tanto, embarcaciones de Salvamento Marítimo mantienen la búsqueda de los dos desaparecidos en la zona próxima al lugar en el que fue avistada la embarcación volcada. Este es el segundo naufragio ocurrido en aguas del Estrecho en el último mes.

column6: drowned while travelling from Turkey to Lesbos (GR)
column7: The dead bodies of a woman and two children were found on 15th March at the coasts of the island and another three were found on Monday morning in the area of Aghios Fokas at Polihnitos.The victims departed from the Turkish coast on 6th March to arrive in Lesvos. According to the official information there are still three people missing from the boatwreck.

column7: The dead bodies of a woman and two children were found on 15th March at the coasts of the island and another three were found on Monday morning in the area of Aghios Fokas at Polihnitos.The victims departed from the Turkish coast on 6th March to arrive in Lesvos. According to the official information there are still three people missing from the boatwreck.

1 drowned while travelling to Spain, 1 Morrocan ferry crew member died in rescue attempt
column7: Two people including a Moroccan rescuer died after a dinghy carrying illegal immigrants capsized in the Strait of Gibraltar, and two others remained missing Saturday, a maritime rescue spokesman told AFP.

column6: went missing while travelling from Morroco to Spain, 2 found dead, 2 rescued
column7: Two people including a Moroccan rescuer died after a dinghy carrying illegal immigrants capsized in the Strait of Gibraltar, and two others remained missing Saturday, a maritime rescue spokesman told AFP.

column6: body found floating near Doumia (Algeria), likely drowned while trying to reach Spain
column7: Jeudi, vers 18h30, un corps flottant en mer est repéré à proximité de la plage de Doumia dans la commune de Béni-Haoua à une vingtaine de km de la ville de Ténès. Il s'agit d'une personne de sexe masculin dont le visage selon des témoins était difficilement identifiable du fait que le corps a séjourné assez longtemps dans la mer. Alertés, les gendarmes accompagnés des sapeurs-pompiers se sont aussitôt rendus sur les lieux et ont procédé à l'évacuation du cadavre vers la morgue de l'hôpital de Ténès. Il faut noter que cette disparition intervient à la suite de la disparition en mer d'un pêcheur âgé de 31 ans, originaire de Ténès. Contacté par nos soins, le directeur de la chambre de pêche M. Abdat Hocine nous dira : à la suite de la découverte du cadavre, nous avons pris contact avec la famille du pêcheur disparu il y a plus de 15 jours pour une identification ; toutefois, précise M. Abdat, les vêtements que porte la victime repêchée ne correspondent pas à ceux que leur proche portait le jour du drame. Apparemment, le corps repêché cette nuit du jeudi est sans doute celui d'un des nombreux harraga qui tentent la traversée à bord d'embarcations de fortune, nous confie le directeur de la chambre de pêche. Toutefois, l'enquête menée par les gendarmes, les tests d'ADN et l'autopsie lèveront le voile sur cette découverte macabre.

column6: fatal heart attack in hospital after kept and brought handcuffed from Heathrow detention center (GB)
column7: An 84-year-old suffering from dementia who was detained at a privately owned immigration centre was taken to hospital in handcuffs and died while in restrains, a report has revealedHe was refused entry into the UK in January last year and, after a stay in hospital, was detained at Harmondsworth and declared unfit for detention a week later. A doctor’s note at the time flagged up that he “requires social careAn attempt to remove Mr Dvorzac was called off on 6 February after a doctor declared him unfit to fly and he was returned to the removal centreHe was taken to hospital in handcuffs on the 8th, and returned to Harmondsworth before returning to hospital on 10 February. He had been in handcuffs for almost five hours when he died.--additional links:http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/inhuman-detention-of-alois-dvorzac-died-deported-ombudsman-inquest-report-a6714256.htmlhttp://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3292846/Alzheimer-s-patient-held-detention-centre-shackled-ambulance-complaining-chest-pains-hours-died-heart-attack.htmlMan, 84, awaiting deportation died in handcuffs 'due to Home Office rules'Paramedic treating Alois Dvorzac for chest pains tells inquest of colleagues’ shock that ‘frail’ patient was taken to hospital in handcuffs and chainsLisa O'CarrollTuesday 27 October 2015 13.20 GMT Last modified on Tuesday 27 October 2015 22.01 GMTAn 84-year-old man being held at a detention centre died of a heart attack after being shackled for five hours while suffering chest pains, an inquest has heard.Alois Dvorzac, a former electrical engineer, was at Harmondsworth immigration removal centre after being denied entry to the UK during a journey from Canada to his native Slovenia.An inquest at West London coroner’s court heard that Dvorzac was taken for emergency treatment on 10 February 2013 from Harmondsworth to a west London hospital with acute coronary syndrome.Paramedic Ricardo Ambrosino said the team who met them at Hillingdon hospital’s A&E department was shocked by the handcuffs and chain.Ambrosino, who treated Dvorzac in the ambulance, said: “The nurse in charge, and there was another nurse there, when they saw him, they were shocked, they were saying: ‘Wow, why is he chained, why is he chained?’ I questioned it as well and I was told it was Home Office procedure. It was unnecessary. He was a frail person. He could barely walk. He was ... unwell.”Jurors heard earlier how Dvorzac had arrived in the UK three weeks earlier from Canada and was travelling to Slovenia to be reunited with his daughter. He had “escaped” from a hospital in Canada where he had been sent from the care home. He was on heavy medication including drugs for dementia and blood thinners for a heart condition.Vernon Simmonds-Dunne, a detention custody officer at Harmondsworth responsible for elderly detainees, told jurors Dvorzac did not understand why he was in detention. “All he kept saying was he wanted to see his family. There was one other question [which] was: ‘When can I go?’” Simmonds-Dunne said.The day Dvorzac was rushed to hospital, his blood sugars were high and his pulse was irregular, jurors heard. He was taken from his bed in Harmondsworth in a wheelchair, placed on the bed in the ambulance and secured by strapping to his chest. He was handcuffed on one wrist with a six-ft-long chain securing him to an escort officer sitting beside him.“I questioned why he was being handcuffed,” said Ambrosino, referring to a man in a white shirt who appeared to be in charge of the emergency escort. “He told me it was Home Office procedures. I felt it was unnecessary. He was an elderly person, he wasn’t going to run away.”Ambrosino said the patient appeared upset and was uncooperative when he tried to conduct a chest examination. He pulled off one of the plastic stickers used for the electrodes and threw it on the floor and then turned to the side of the ambulance and went quiet.The senior coroner, Chinyere Inyama, asked Ambrosino if he had been told that the handcuffing procedures were in place because of previous escapes. He replied: “No, I was just told it was Home Office procedure.”Earlier, the jury heard that Dvorzac had suffered two heart attacks and was on 13 medications. After spending his first night in Gatwick airport, he was taken to a hospital for assessment and was deemed fit to be returned to Canada. Plans were in place for a deportation but he died in hospital. His relatives were told months later.On Monday, one of the two officers who escorted him to hospital told the court it was routine for detainees to be handcuffed. Dvorzac’s handcuffs were taken off only “when they realised he had stopped breathing”, said Katerina Tanasan, one of the custody officers working for the private firm Geo.On Tuesday, Emma Donoghue, head of primary care at Heathrow’s immigration removal centre, said a system was set up 12 months ago to deal with detainees who showed “vulnerabilities outside the norm”.The weekly meeting of Home Office staff, site operators, and health workers would deal with “rare” cases like that of Dvorzac she said. It would try and find a secure hospital place for a detainee like him and try and locate relatives.Simmonds-Dunne said he told Dvorzac about plans to deport him to Canada and not on to Slovenia. “The emotion went down a bit. He looked a bit tearful. What he actually said was: ‘I don’t have much time. I need to see my family,” he said.Asked by one juror if he had the impression Dvorzac wanted to go home to die, Simmonds-Dunne replied: “Every time I saw him, he was out of bed and smartly dressed as if he was ready to walk out and continue his journey.”The inquest continues.

column6: pushed onto a metro track by police officers during a chase in Athens (GR)
column7: On the night between 1st-2nd February 2013 Cheick Ndiaye's body was found on the rail tracks of Thissio metro station in central Athens. A friend, who was a witness states he saw Cheick being pushed to his death by two municipality police officers who were chasing him. Cheick was a migrant from Senegal.

column6: died of exposure on riverbank near GR-TR border, after trafficker abandoned him & 8 others
column7: A 16-year-old boy was found dead of exposure early on Tuesday on the banks of the Evros River in Didymoteicho, near the Greek-Turkish border.The teenager was traveling with another eight people - five women, two children and a man - when they were dumped on the riverbank by their trafficker, identified as a Turkish national. They were found later by officers of a border patrol unit.The eight unidentified migrants were being treated in a local hospital for hypothermia.

column6: committed suicide in Rotterdam (NL) out of fear of deportation
column12: UNITED/ VK/ Telegraaf/ ANP/ NRC/ Parool/ MNS/ Trouw

column6: stabbed by two Golden Dawn members in Athens (GR)
column7: The protest occurs just two days after the attack against Pakistani migrant who was stabbed to death by two Greeks in Petralona suburb of Athens.  Sahdjat Lukman, 27, was stabbed he was going to work riding on a bicycle. He had come to Greece six years ago and was holder of a provisional residence permit. Police arrested the two perpetrators just hours after the attack, with one of them being a firefighter. In the home of one of the suspects, police found leaflets of extreme-right Chrysi Avgi (Golden Dawn), a party elected to the Greek Parliament last June, a party with a clear anti-migrants policies which often turn violent.The 27-year-old Pakistani was stabbed to death by two men on a motorcycle as he rode his bicycle to work in an Athens suburb in the early hours of Wednesday, in an attack police say may have been racially motivated.

column6: 2 bodies found off Chios (GR) by fishermen, another body found by coast guard
column7: ATHENS, Greece –  Greece's coast guard says the bodies of three would-be migrants have been retrieved in the waters off the eastern Aegean island of Chios.Two of the bodies were found Sunday morning by fishermen and the third early in the afternoon by a coast guard vessel. All three were men, who were presumably trying to cross into Greece from nearby Turkey.ADVERTISEMENTA coast guard spokesman, speaking on condition of anonymity because he was not authorized to speak on the record to media, confirmed that an autopsy on the first two bodies showed they had drowned.Tens of thousands of illegal migrants cross into Greece annually, most over the land and sea border with Turkey. The sea crossing, brief but often through turbulent waters and involving overloaded boats, is sometimes fatal.

column6: hanged himself in a police prison in Zurich (Switzerland)
column7: on January 4, 2013 a Kurdish asylum seeker hung himself in a police prison in Zurich.

column6: missing, trying to reach the Apulian coast of Italy, 28 rescued
column7: ITALY / 40 undocumented migrants missing off Apulia’s coastAbout 70 undocumented migrants originating from Syria, Afghanistan and Pakistan tried to reach the Apulian coast of Italy, on the night of 3 January 2013. Whilst 28 were rescued, the majority appeared to be missing, including eight children aged 11-13 years old. According to the witnesses’ depositions, the eight children might have escaped previously on board a spare boat and may be alive. Adult survivors were sent to reception centres across the region.Source: La Repubblica, 4 January 2012

column6: drowned after being pushed in the sea by traffickers off the Sicilian coast (IT)
column7: ITALY / DEATH AT BORDER / Undocumented migrant dead as result of traffickers’ violenceApproximately 40 migrants from Tunisia embarked on a journey towards Sicily on 31 December 2012. According to the survivors’ deposition to the police, the traffickers on board pushed the migrants into the waters a few metres off the Sicilian coast despite the inability of some of the migrants to swim. As a result, one migrant drowned at sea and his body was found near Trapani. According to the survivors’ story, another migrant did not make it safely to the coast, but his body was not found. The traffickers, also Tunisian citizens, have been imprisoned.Source: La Repubblica 1 January 2013

column6: missing, reportedly drowned, after being pushed in sea by traffickers off Sicilian coast (IT)
column7: ITALY / DEATH AT BORDER / Undocumented migrant dead as result of traffickers’ violenceApproximately 40 migrants from Tunisia embarked on a journey towards Sicily on 31 December 2012. According to the survivors’ deposition to the police, the traffickers on board pushed the migrants into the waters a few metres off the Sicilian coast despite the inability of some of the migrants to swim. As a result, one migrant drowned at sea and his body was found near Trapani. According to the survivors’ story, another migrant did not make it safely to the coast, but his body was not found. The traffickers, also Tunisian citizens, have been imprisoned.Source: La Repubblica 1 January 2013

column6: tortured to death in Chechnya after Norway forced him to return to Russia
column7: On 17 December 2015, the Norwegian magazine Ny Tid reported that two rejected Chechen asylum seekers who were repatriated in spite of strong and serious warnings that they would be maltreated and tortured, had been murdered under atrociously cruel circumstances, especially Apti NAZJUJEV.The other, Umar BILEMKHANOV, was found dead and the Chechen authorities claimed that he had perished in a car accident.Both the Norwegian Helsinki Committee and the Russian human rights group Memorial issued strong warnings to the Norwegian authorities not to send the two men to either Russia or Chechnya.Essentially, the reasoning of the Norwegian authorities was that whilst they were prepared to accept that he two men were not safe in Chechnya, they could make use of the internal flight alternative, for example by remaining in Moscow....Mr BILEMKHANOV had his asylum application turned down and had exhausted all means of appeal, including the application to the Norwegian Supreme Court.All instances considered that it was safe for him to make use of the internal flight alternative.In 2011, Mr BILEMKHANOV and his family were deported from Norway.Upon their arrival in Moscow, Mr BILEMKHANOV was taken into custody and, according to Memorial, he was forcibly sent by the Russian authorities to Chechnya.When he arrived in Chechnya, he was informed that his father had been beaten to death by police.Memorial has claimed that Mr BILEMKHANOV was subsequently taken into police custody and tortured with electric cables.The Chechen authorities claimed that he had been found dead on 26 December 2012, and that he had perished as a result of a traffic accident.Both Memorial and the Helsinki Committee have pointed out that there was no damage to the car which he was supposed to have been using and his family members were not given the opportunity to see his body.Commenting on these two cases on behalf of the Norwegian Immigration authorities (UDI), Torgeir TOFTE JøRGENSEN of the Immigraton Appeals Board (UNE) defended the decisions to deny both men asylum in Norway.‘’We believe that the decisions made were correct. One was heard by three judicial bodies where everyone agreed with the UNE.’’... Mr JøRGENSEN  pointed out that Mr BILEMKHANOV and his family had left Norway under the programme of assisted repatriation carried out by the International Organisation for Migration (IOM), and had lived in Chechnya for a year and a half before his death. (In fact, it was less than 14 months and not a year and a half.)...Memorial informed that Mr BILEMKHANOV was forbidden to reside in Russia and that he was escorted to Chechnya by a police unit. The Russian and Chechen authorities work very closely together.

column6: 20 died, 6 missing after boat from Turkey sank near Lesbos (GR); 2 survivors
column7: GREECE / DEATH AT BORDER / Twenty migrants drown in Aegean SeaA boat carrying about 28 people from Turkey to Greece sank near the Greek island of Lesvos, in the Aegean Sea, on 14 December 2012. The Greek coast guard found twenty bodies in the sea and during the search for survivors only one person was rescued from the water. The nationalities of the migrants was not disclosed, but according to the survivors the migrants were from Iraq, and the boat’s owner from Turkey. Source: Al Jazeera, 15 December 2012; Reuters, 15 December 2012

column6: drowned when boat from Turkey sank near Lesbos (GR); 2 survivors
column7: On Saturday 15th December in the early morning hours the coast guard found 18 corpses of migrant men and one survivor in Thermi, Lesvos. Until now 21 corpses have been found, two persons have survived (one is in Mytilini and one in Turkey) and seven are still missing. The survivor found first on the Greek side informed the authorities that they had started with a ship of 30 migrants from Turkey which capsized on Friday. the authorities try to locate the rest of the migrants in the sea now – among them two women and two children.Only one 16-year-old survivor has been plucked out of the water and was hospitalised in the island capital Mytilene and another 17-year-old on the Turkish side. The young boy found in the sea near Lesvos told investigators most of those on board the boat which also carried women and children were from Afghanistan with only two persons from Turkey. Greek public television Net said two women and two children had been among the passengers. The group set sail from the western coast of Turkey on Thursday but ran into bad weather that sank their boat during the night, about two miles off Lesvos.UPDATE: Two of the corpses were recognised by relatives living in Greece and Sweden respectively. One of the is a 17-year-old whose cousin came to recognise him from Naxos where he is living and the other is a 42-year-old whose brother came from Sweden to check for his whereabouts. Through the recognition of the 17-year-old it became known that there has been found another survivor on the Turkish side. The young survivor found in Lesvos left hospital on Tuesday 18 and was transferred to the detention cells of the coast guard.

column6: 1 drowned, 7 missing, after patrol boat clashed with boat carrying 25 migrants (ES)
column7: SPAIN / Guardia Civil patrol boat clashes with a boat carrying 25 migrantsA Guardia Civil patrol boat clashed with a boat carrying 25 migrants originating from Morocco on 14 December 2012, off the shores of Lanzarote. As a result of the clash, seven migrants were lost at sea and one was found dead. The Guardia Civil managed to rescue seventeen other migrants. According to Guardia Civil, a broken turbine on their patrol boat resulted in the boat crashing against the migrants’ boat. According to the survivors’ declaration in the local court of Arrecife (Lanzarote) the patrol boat approached them at high speed and without lights, so they could only hear its engine. This contradicts the Guardia Civil’s claim that they acted in compliance with protocol and that the patrol lights were on when approaching the migrants’ boat. Source: EL Pais, 17 December 2012 and EL Pais,18 December, 2012

column6: 1 man froze to death near Kraynovo (BG) trying to cross BG/TR border, 1 man in hospital
column7: BULGARIA / DEATH AT BORDER / Syrian migrant found dead at Bulgarian-Turkish border, another in hospitalA man from Syria froze to death on the Bulgarian-Turkish border near the village of Kraynovo, in the southeast of Bulgaria. Another man was transferred to a hospital in Elhovo, also in the southeast of Bulgaria, in a critical condition. Both men were trying to cross the Bulgarian-Turkish border. It seems that bad weather conditions were the cause of the incident as the two men were unable to meet the person helping them cross the border.  It is estimated that over 1,700 irregular migrants crossed the Bulgarian-Turkish border in 2011. Source: Vreme, 21 December 2012

column6: drowned trying to reach Italy by boat from Libya; 500 others rescued
column7: PALERMO - Quasi 500 migranti in 48 ore, il centro di prima accoglienza di Lampedusa oltre la capienza massima, condizioni meteo favorevoli almeno per altri due giorni. E il tam tam secondo cui dall' altra parte del Canale ci sarebbero di nuovo migliaia di persone in attesa di partire. In Sicilia è di nuovo emergenza immigrazione. Dopo i 350 clandestini soccorsi dalla Guardia costiera sabato in due diverse operazioni di salvataggio tra Malta e Lampedusa, ieri mattina 80 migranti sono stati soccorsi all' 1.30 del mattino nel Siracusano, 30 miglia a sud di Portopalo di Capo Passero. A bordo del gommone dal quale, con un telefono satellitare era partito l' allarme, c' erano anche 25 donne, una incinta. I profughi sono eritrei e somali, a differenza dei quasi 350 arrivati a Lampedusa negli ultimi due giorni: partiti quasi certamente dalla Libia e intercettati dalle motovedette a poche miglia dall' isola. La traversata è costata la vita ad almeno un uomo (ma altri due sono dispersi) tra quelli arrivati sulle coste agrigentine, a Montallegro. E il sindaco di Lampedusa, Giusi Nicolini, torna a lanciare l' allarme affinché riprendano i trasferimenti dei migranti ospitati nel centro di prima accoglienza che, dopo gli ultimi sbarchi, ha già superato quota 1.000 ospiti. (alessandra ziniti) © RIPRODUZIONE RISERVATA

column6: committed suicide in a hospital in Winterthur (CH) after rejection of his asylum application
column7: on November 19 an Armenian asylum seeker was found dead in a hospital.La nuit précédente, un requérant débouté arménien, lui aussi emprisonné à Zurich mais pour des faits pénaux, s’était ôté la vie dans un hôpital à Winterthour.

column6: committed suicide in a psychiatric clinic in Liestal (Switzerland)
column7: eine Asylsuchende aus Eritrea in einer psychiatrischen Klinik in Liestal Selbstmord. Der Frau stand eine Dublin-Abschiebung nach Italien bevor, gegen die sie sich verzweifelt gewehrt hatte. Nachdem ihre Reiseunfähigkeit attestiert wurde, hatte man sie in die Klinik gebracht.

column6: hanged himself in Zurich (CH), asylum claim rejected, feared persecution in RUS for being gay
column7: Oleg N. ist am Montagmorgen, dem 12.11.12, um 5 Uhr morgens tot in seiner Zelle im Zürcher Flughafengefängnis aufgefunden worden. Der psychisch labile Mann hatte sich erhängt, nachdem auf seinen Asylantrag nicht eingetreten worden war und er für sich offensichtlich keinen Ausweg mehr sah.Oleg N. war im Februar dieses Jahres aus Russland in die Schweiz geflüchtet, weil er in seinem Heimatland als Homosexueller von der Polizei verfolgt, schwer misshandelt und unter schwerster Medikation zweimal für mehr als ein Jahr in einer psychiatrischen Klinik festgehalten worden war.Im Februar 2012 stellte Oleg N., schwer traumatisiert, in der Schweiz ein Asylgesuch. Am letzten Montag nahm er sich im Flughafengefängnis das Leben. Zuvor war ihm ein Nichteintretensentscheid ausgehändigt worden, nachdem er wegen mehrerer Aufenthalte in psychiatrischen Kliniken im In- und  Ausland nicht zu Anhörungen erschienen war. Nur zwei Tage nach seiner Entlassung aus einer mehrmonatigen Behandlung in einer geschlossenen Klinik kam er in die Ausschaffungshaft.

column6: body found floating in the water 12 miles from Tarifa (ES)
column7: Por otra parte, otro mercante localizó ayer por la mañana el cadáver de un varón de raza negra flotando en el agua a unas 12 millas al suroeste de Tarifa. El fallecido llevaba un chaleco de color naranja. Según indicaron fuentes de Salvamento Marítimo, no puede confirmarse aún que el fallecido fuera uno de los ocupantes de dicha patera, ya que podría ser víctima de otro naufragio.

column6: missing, reportedly drowned, after boat sank in Strait of Gibraltar near Tarifa (ES)
column7: Suspenden la búsqueda de tres inmigrantes desaparecidos en aguas del EstrechoDos ocupantes de la patera fueron rescatados por un mercanteABC, ep, 09-11-2012Salvamento Marítimo ha suspendido el dispositivo de búsqueda de los tres inmigrantes desaparecidos este miércoles en aguas del Estrecho tras naufragar la patera con la que trataban de alcanzar costas españolas. Los otros dos ocupantes de la patera fueron rescatados de las aguas por un mercante.Según han confirmado fuentes del dispositivo, la búsqueda se suspendió definitivamente en la tarde del miércoles al descartarse la posibilidad de que pudiera haber supervivientes, máxime teniendo en cuenta las condiciones meteorológicas en la zona, en alerta por temporal de lluvia y viento.Salvamento Marítimo informaba este miércoles que a primera hora de la jornada, el mercante «Federal Oshima» comunicó al Centro de Salvamento Marítimo de Tarifa que había avistado una balsa inflable a la deriva y sin personas a bordo que se hallaba a 12 millas al suroeste de Tarifa.De inmediato, activó un dispositivo de búsqueda formado por la embarcación de intervención rápida «Salvamar Alkaid», la «Salvamar Atria» y el helicóptero «Helimer 206». Posteriormente, el buque «Vinlandia», que también se encontraba en las proximidades del naufragio, informó de que había rescatado a dos personas del agua.Según las declaraciones de los rescatados a bordo de la patera viajaban cinco personas, por lo que podría haber tres desaparecidos. Un helicóptero de Salvamento Marítimo y dos embarcaciones emprendieron la búsqueda, dándose por suspendidas al descartarse la posibilidad de supervivientes.

column6: body found near the coast of Ceuta (ES), presumably tried to swim there from Morocco
column7: Spain Found the body of a sub-Saharan immigrant near the coast of Ceuta The first hypothesis suggests that the deceased had tried to go swimming in the city La Voz de Galicia, EFE, 05-11-2012 The Civil Guard found the body of a 30-year sub-Saharan immigrant floating on the sea coast near Ceuta. According to informed sources the military institution, the body was found today in the waters of North Bay by the Maritime Service of the Civil Guard during a routine inspection. The first hypothesis suggests that the immigrant, wearing a wetsuit and carrying dead few days, had tried to go swimming in the city. Officers found a passport that allowed us to determine the identity of the deceased, Saar Yatta, 30. The body has been taken to the city morgue for autopsy practice that, although early data suggest that drowned.

column6: body found on coast of Nador (MA) near Spanish enclave of Melilla
column7: RABAT (AFP) - More than 90 illegal sub-Saharan migrants have died attempting to reach Spain from Morocco in the past two weeks, a Moroccan security source and members of the African immigrant community said on Tuesday."According to the testimonies of six survivors who managed to reach Spain, 54 people on the same boat drowned last week," said Pierre Delagrange, president of the sub-Saharan immigrant community in Morocco.Another 19 sub-Saharans were confirmed to have died off the coast of Tangier, Morocco's northern port city, just 14 kilometres (eight miles) from Spain, in the past fortnight, he added."Yesterday (Monday) three bodies were recovered from a beach near Tangier, bringing the number of dead there to 19, including women and children," Duladrang said, adding that two more who attempted the sea crossing were still missing.A Senegalese in Tangier contacted by AFP, who identified himself only as Osman, gave the same toll of 54 from last week's boat tragedy and 19 dead off Tangier.A Moroccan security source said the body of a sub-Saharan migrant was found on the coast at Nador on Monday, near Spain's north African enclave of Melilla, after the body of a man and his young son were found in the same area last week.The casualty figure of 76 raise the number of African migrants confirmed to have drowned in the waters between Morocco and Spain in the past two weeks to 92.On October 26, the Muslim festival of Eid al-Adha, two Africans died and lifeguards rescued about 50 trying to reach Spain by boat from Morocco, a day after 14 others were pulled dead from the water, according to Spanish emergency services.They are the most recent victims in a steady wave of migrants attempting to reach Spanish soil from Morocco, many of them in makeshift rafts, that has swelled in recent weeks.The Moroccan authorities have saved around 6,500 illegal migrants from death at sea in the past five years, according to the official MAP news agency.Another 23,000 sub-Saharans planning to attempt the dangerous crossing have reportedly been arrested in Morocco over the same period.

column6: drowned after ship travelling to Lampedusa (IT) sank off the coast of Libya; 70 rescued
column7: Undici i cadaveri nel mare della LibiaCrocetta accoglie i naufraghi a LampedusaE' di una donna il corpo dell'ultima vittima recuperato nel tardo pomeriggio, prima che venissero sospese le ricerche dei dispersi. I sopravvissuti al naufragio del barcone sono arrivati in Sicilia. Il neo-governatore: "E' un confronto con il dolore di un popolo costretto a  fuggire dalla miseria"LAMPEDUSA - Sono undici le vittime accertate del naufragio del barcone di immigrati che si è rovesciato ieri sera nel Canale di Sicilia. La Guardia costiera italiana ha recuperato nel pomeriggio, a circa 35 miglia dalla Libia, il cadavere di una donna. Il bilancio sale così a undici morti: otto donne e tre uomini.

column6: drowned in shipwreck between Morocco and Spain; 6 survivors
column7: Plus de 90 migrants d'Afrique subsaharienne sont morts au cours des deux dernières semaines en tentant de rejoindre l'Espagne depuis le Maroc, a-t-on appris mardi auprès de membres de la communauté africaine immigrée et d'une source de la sécurité marocaine."D'après les témoignages de six survivants ayant réussi à rejoindre l'Espagne, 54 personnes sur une même embarcation sont mortes noyées la semaine dernière", affirme Pierre Delagrange, président du Collectif des communautés subsahariennes au Maroc.

column6: died of unknown causes in the Harmondsworth detention centre (GB)
column7: On 30 October, a man was found dead at Harmondsworth removal centre in west London.The deceased has been named as 31-year-old Prince Kwabena Fosu from Ghana. The Home Office released a one-sentence statement and refused to answer any questions: ‘This death is being investigated so it would be inappropriate to comment at this stage. We will work with the Prisons and Probation Ombudsman during the investigation.’ A post mortem has found no evidence of violence, restraint or suicide.

column6: drowned while attempting to reach Spain by boat from Morocco; 50 rescued
column7: Le 26 octobre, pendant la fête musulmane de l'Adha, deux migrants africains sont morts et une cinquantaine ont été secourus alors qu'ils tentaient de gagner l'Espagne en bateau depuis le Maroc.

column6: drowned after boat sank near coast of Morocco while travelling to Spain; 17 rescued
column7: Spanish search-and-rescue teams on Thursday saved 17 would-be immigrants from a sinking boat 18 miles off the coast of Alhucemas, Morocco, but recovered 14 bodies from the water of the Alborán Sea. The deployment of the Maritime Safety units came after a family member of one of the passengers raised the alarm.Around 35 people were thought to be on board the vessel, which set off from Nador on the Moroccan coast overnight. The search-and-rescue operation began early on Wednesday morning. An aircraft soon spotted the boat and dropped an inflatable raft, onto which some survivors were able to climb.A lifeboat followed the directions given by the air reconnaissance, where it was joined by one Civil Guard and two Moroccan vessels. The survivors, 14 men and three women, were taken to the Moroccan port of Alhucemas. Some of the passengers were in need of urgent medical attention.

column6: missing after boat sank near coast of Morocco while travelling to Spain; 17 rescued

column6: fell into the sea while travelling from Morococo, body washed ashore near Punta Almina (ES)
drowned, body found near Galapagos beach in the Spanish encalve of Melilla
column7: La Guardia Civil rescata el cadáver de una menor subsaharianaLa niña pudo naufragar el lunes por la noche cerca de Calatrifa, cuando viajaba con otras 17 personas más a bordo de una patera 10.10.12 - 01:22 - SUR | MELILLA.ImprimirEnviarRectificar 1 voto2 votos3 votos4 votos5 votos0 votos Comenta esta noticia |En TuentiUna patrulla de Seguridad Ciudadana de la Guardia Civil descubrió ayer al mediodía un cuerpo humano flotando en las proximidades de la playa de los Galápagos. Los agentes confirmaron que se trataba del cuerpo de una menor, de origen subsahariano, de entre cuatro y cinco años de edad. Activado el protocolo, miembros del Grupo Especial de Actividades Subacuáticas rescataron el cadáver.Se descarta que la pequeña viajara en la patera que zozobró cerca de las costas melillenses en la madrugada del lunes, un accidente que se cobró la vida de un bebé de aproximadamente 8 meses y por el que tuvieron que ser atendidas en el Hospital Comarcal varias inmigrantes subsaharianas.La Delegación del Gobierno cree que la menor fallecida pudo naufragar el lunes por la noche cerca de Calatrifa, cuando viajaba a bordo de una patera con 17 personas. Cinco de ellas - tres mujeres adultas y dos menores de ambos sexos- seguían desaparecidas a última hora de la tarde de ayer.El delegado del Gobierno insiste en subrayar la tragedia inherente a la inmigración irregular, al tiempo que reitera sus denuncias contra las mafias que trafican con seres humanos y contribuyen a promover flujos ilegales de inmigración en condiciones extremadamente peligrosas para los propios inmigrantes.

column6: drowned after boat from Comoros capsized off the coast of Mayotte (FR)
went missing after boat from Comoros capsized off the coast of Mayotte (FR)
went missing after boat capsized near the Spanish enclave of Melilla

column6: drowned after boat sank off the Spanish enclave of Melilla
column7: Un bebé de origen subsahariano, de ocho meses de edad, ha muerto ahogado este lunes en Melilla al hundirse la patera en la que viajaba con otras 13 personas cuando ya estaban prácticamente a punto de llegar a la costa de la ciudad española del norte de África.Según han informado fuentes policiales, el niño fallecido estaba en la embarcación junto con su madre, otra menor, tres mujeres y nueve varones cuando esta naufragó cerca de las dos de la madrugada por razones que se están investigando.El naufragio de la embarcación, tipo neumática, se ha producido a la altura del faro situado junto a las escolleras de la zona conocida como Trápana.Los efectivos del Grupo de Especialistas en Actividades Subacuáticas (GEAS) acudieron al lugar para auxiliar a los inmigrantes pero no pudieron hacer nada por salvar la vida del bebé.La madre del niño ha sido ingresada en la Unidad de Cuidados Intensivos (UCI) del Hospital Comarcal, después de tragar mucha agua. La mujer apenas sabía nadar y ni ella ni el resto de los ocupantes de la patera pudieron salvar al pequeño tras caer de la embarcación.Salvo el bebé fallecido y las tres mujeres que necesitaron de asistencia médica en el Hospital Comarcal, los adultos y el menor llegaron en buen estado.Los adultos han sido trasladados al Centro de Estancia Temporal de Inmigrantes (CETI), en tanto que el menor ha quedado a disposición de la Policía Local para su posterior traslado a uno de los centros de acogida dependientes del Gobierno autonómico.

column6: fell from 5th floor window in Larnaca (CY) while escaping police responding to a noise report
19 bodies found, 2 people missing, off the coast of Tangier (Morocco) over 2 weeks
column7: RABAT (AFP) - More than 90 illegal sub-Saharan migrants have died attempting to reach Spain from Morocco in the past two weeks, a Moroccan security source and members of the African immigrant community said on Tuesday."According to the testimonies of six survivors who managed to reach Spain, 54 people on the same boat drowned last week," said Pierre Delagrange, president of the sub-Saharan immigrant community in Morocco.Another 19 sub-Saharans were confirmed to have died off the coast of Tangier, Morocco's northern port city, just 14 kilometres (eight miles) from Spain, in the past fortnight, he added."Yesterday (Monday) three bodies were recovered from a beach near Tangier, bringing the number of dead there to 19, including women and children," Duladrang said, adding that two more who attempted the sea crossing were still missing.A Senegalese in Tangier contacted by AFP, who identified himself only as Osman, gave the same toll of 54 from last week's boat tragedy and 19 dead off Tangier.A Moroccan security source said the body of a sub-Saharan migrant was found on the coast at Nador on Monday, near Spain's north African enclave of Melilla, after the body of a man and his young son were found in the same area last week.The casualty figure of 76 raise the number of African migrants confirmed to have drowned in the waters between Morocco and Spain in the past two weeks to 92.On October 26, the Muslim festival of Eid al-Adha, two Africans died and lifeguards rescued about 50 trying to reach Spain by boat from Morocco, a day after 14 others were pulled dead from the water, according to Spanish emergency services.They are the most recent victims in a steady wave of migrants attempting to reach Spanish soil from Morocco, many of them in makeshift rafts, that has swelled in recent weeks.The Moroccan authorities have saved around 6,500 illegal migrants from death at sea in the past five years, according to the official MAP news agency.Another 23,000 sub-Saharans planning to attempt the dangerous crossing have reportedly been arrested in Morocco over the same period.--Dix-neuf autres sont mortes au large de Tanger, à 14 km de l'Espagne, au cours des deux dernières semaines, a-t-il ajouté. "Hier (lundi), trois corps ont été retrouvés sur une plage près de Tanger, portant à 19 le nombre de morts là, notamment des femmes et des enfants", a dit M. Delagrange.

column6: Kurd, suicide after final rejection of asylum, in Saltdal refugee centre, Rognan (Norway)
column7: Kurdiske Newzad (20) prøvde flere ganger å ta livet sitt. Forrige fredag lyktes han– Han ba flere ganger om hjelp, men ble ofte overlatt til seg selv, sier Alex Armando, som kjente 20-åringen som sist fredag tok livet sitt på asylmottaket i Saltdal.TOK SITT EGET LIV: Fredag i forrige uke tok 20 år gamle Newzad fra Irak sitt eget liv ute i skogen like ved Rognan Mottakssenter i Saltdal. Han hadde fått endelig avslag på asylsøknaden sin.– Jeg kjenner mange som har fått endelig avslag og som blir sittende på asylmottak. Ventetida blir lang og tung, og det tar på psykisk, sier Armando til NRK.no.Fredag i forrige uke tok 20 år gamle Newzad fra Irak sitt eget liv ute i skogen like ved Rognan Mottakssenter i nordlandskommunen Saltdal.Han var en av over 40 beboere ved mottaket med endelig avslag på asylsøknaden og ei svært usikker framtid.Dødsfallet har gått sterkt inn på både ansatte og beboerne på mottaket.– Det preger oss alle sammen. Det er veldig trist. Våre tanker går til Newzads familie og de beboerne som har hatt mest kontakt med ham, sier mottaksleder Anita Paulsen ved asylmottaket på Rognan til NRK.no.18 dødsfall så langt i årNewzad ble den 18 asylsøkeren som har mistet livet på norske mottak i år. Men ingen vet hvor mange av dem som har tatt livet sitt. Noen mil unna i Bodø er det kurdiske miljøet frustrert over at hjelpen kom for sent.– Det var veldig trist det som skjedde. Han hadde slitt lenge med hodet, og prøvd flere ganger å ta livet sitt. Han ba flere ganger om hjelp, men ble ofte overlatt til seg selv, noe han ikke burde, sier kurderen Alex Armando, som kjente Newzad godt.Ifølge vennen var Newzad lagt inn på sykehus, men fikk lov å reise hjem til Rognan.– Mange klikkerArmando kjenner mange asylsøkere som blir sittende på mottak etter at de har fått avslag på asylsøknaden sin.– Mange kan klikke om de ikke får hjelp. Problemet er at man må vente for lenge slik det fungerer i dag. Saksbehandlingstiden bør ned så at man får raskere svar samtidig som de som får avslag må få hjelp til å sendes raskere ut, mener han.På Rognan ønsker ikke mottaksledelsen å kommentere dødsfallet nærmere – men for leder Anita Paulsen er bekymringen at stadig flere blir sittende lenge på mottak med endelig avslag.– De oppholder seg ulovlig i Norge. Derfor bør det skje noe når det gjelder ventetiden for uttransporteringen. Den går ikke raskt nok i dag, sier hun til NRK.no.NOAS bekymretOgså norsk organisasjon for asylsøkere (NOAS) er bekymret for den helsemessige oppfølging av asylsøkere som blir sittende på mottakene. – Det er opplagt at det er en belastning å vente så lenge. Mange av disse har rømt fra veldig vanskelige situasjoner. Noen av dem har traumatiske opplevelser. Det å bo tett oppå hverandre når du kommer fra helt forskjellige kulturer, i bygninger som definitivt ikke er bygd for dette formålet, kan fort skape spenninger. Det å ikke kunne jobbe eller utøve andre aktiviteter, blir en ekstra belastning for folk som sliter i utgangspunktet, sier generalsekretær Ann-Margrit Austenå i NOAS.I Bodø håper også vennene til Newzad at situasjon for asylsøkerne på mottak med psykiske problemer blir bedre, før det går galt igjen.– Jeg kjenner mange unge menn både i Bodø og i Saltdal som framstår som friske, men som fort kan klikke. UDI bør jobbe sammen for å finne gode løsninger for disse unge mennene. Det er ikke bare bra for dem, men også for den norske befolkningen, sier Alex Armando.Har seg selv å takke for lang ventetidNår asylsøkerne får avslag må de vente ofte mange år før de blir transportert ut av landet. Ifølge politiet har asylsøkerne seg selv å takk dersom de må sitte i mottakene å vente.– Når det siste negative vedtaket om avslaget er meddelt får de en utreisefrist på en måned. Da har man muligheten til å reise frivillig og motta en pengesum. Dersom det ikke skjer, er det politiets rolle å føre disse personene ut av landet, sier politioverbetjent Harald Jacobsen, som er sjef for Utlendingsenheten ved Salten politidistrikt.Utfordringen til politiet er at ikke kan være sikker på identiteten til disse menneskene.– Vi skal ha dem verifisert og akseptert av hjemlandet før de kan returneres, og det kan ofte ta svært lang tid dersom disse personene ikke samarbeider med politiet for å framskaffe identifikasjonspapirer. Da må vi gå andre veier og andre kanaler, og dette tar også tid, sier Jacobsen.At ventetiden kan bli lang og tung for dem som venter, er godt kjent hos politiet.– Den frustrasjonen kan jeg forstå. Men samtidig er det vanskelig for oss å forstå at de ikke da samarbeider med oss og framlegger sin virkelige identitet, sier Jacobsen.Politiet bruker i dag store ressurser både lokalt og sentralt i utlendingsenheten på å framskaffe identitetsdokumenter.I årets ni første måneder har det vært 18 dødsfall i norske asylmottak.Ifølge tall fra UDI har antallet beboere på norske mottak gått ned fra 20.000 i 2009 til 15.700 i 2011. I samme tidsrom har antall dødsfall ved mottakene gått opp. ISelvmord, barneulykker og drap er blant dødsårsakene, ifølge UDI.

column6: suffered fatal heart attack in deportation centre in Vienna after being refused treatment
1 drowned, 2 missing, after boat capsized off coast of Spain, 9 others rescued
column7: “Han vuelto a nacer”, comentaba ayer un responsable de Salvamento Marítimo en el puerto de Alicante tras rescatar a ocho inmigrantes náufragos en alta mar. En la operación se localizó el cadáver de otro inmigrante y se trataba de encontrar a otros dos desaparecidos.Los inmigrantes, 12 en total, viajaban desde el lunes en una pequeña embarcación que al parecer volcó por la marejada sobre las 9.00 de ayer, a unas 20 millas al este de Torrevieja. Al cierre de esta edición no había rastro de los otros dos náufragos.Todos los inmigrantes rescatados, de entre 16 y 27 años, son de nacionalidad argelina, y según su testimonio cuatro son menores. Sus caras, apesadumbradas, reflejaban la odisea que vivieron en el mar durante casi seis largas horas. Algunos de ellos, nada más tocar tierra en el puerto de Alicante, reclamaban por señas a los voluntarios de la Cruz Roja algo de comida y agua.

column6: fell overboard while going to Spain, found in advanced state of decomposition off Ceuta (ES)
drowned on the way to Spain when small boat sank off coast of Mostaganem (Algeria)
died when car driven by smuggler overturned near Alexandropoulis (GR) during police chase
stowaway, body fell from a plane onto street in Mortlake (GB), flight from Angola to England
column7: A young man whose body was found on a pavement in west London almost certainly died after stowing away inside the landing gear of a British Airways flight from Angola in a desperate attempt to make a new life in the UK, an inquest has heard.José Matada was either dead or at the point of death due to hypothermia and lack of oxygen when he fell from the plane as its undercarriage opened for its descent into Heathrow airport, west London coroners court was told.He died on his 26th birthday, with a single pound coin in his pocket, as well as currency from Botswana. He is believed to have originally come from Mozambique,

column6: went missing after boat from Comoros carrying 36 migrants sank off coast of Mayotte (FR)
drowned after boat from Comoros carrying 36 migrants sank off coast of Mayotte (FR)
shot by Egyptian border guards in Rafah (EGY) after fleeing towards the Egypt-Israel border
column7: Rafah, Egypt: An Egyptian security official says border guards have shot dead an African migrant near the border with Israel.The official said the 25-year-old Eritrean refused to surrender when police fired warning shots in the air and continued running toward the Israeli border near Rafah in Egypt’s Sinai Peninsula on Saturday. In a separate incident, the official says authorities arrested 26 migrants from Sudan, Eritrea and Ethiopia before they reached the border. He spoke on condition of anonymity because he was not authorised to brief the media.Hundreds of Africans seeking political asylum and jobs try to illegally enter Israel every year, in long perilous desert trips, often with the help of Bedouin traffickers. Egyptian guards trying to stem the flow have killed dozens of migrants in recent years.

column6: missing after boat sank off coast of Lampedusa (IT); 56 rescued
column7: ITALY / DEATH AT THE BORDER / Still not found the boat disappeared on 7 September off the coasts of LampedusaThe Italian Authorities are still investigating the disappearance of the boat which sunk off the coasts of Lampedusa in the night of 6 September 2012. According to survivors, the boat sunk when trying to land on the coasts of Sicily. The Italian Coastguard have not yet been able to find the boat and only three bodies of the 79 migrants who were travelling on the boat have been found. The Italian Authorities have however arrested the three smugglers who are allegedly responsible for the tragedy and are currently investigating whether it could be possible that the migrants were actually abandoned at sea, which would explain why it has not until now been possible to locate the supposedly-sunken boat.

column6: drowned after boat sank off coast of Lampedusa (IT); 56 rescued
column7: ITALY / DEATH AT THE BORDER / Still not found the boat disappeared on 7 September off the coasts of LampedusaThe Italian Authorities are still investigating the disappearance of the boat which sunk off the coasts of Lampedusa in the night of 6 September 2012. According to survivors, the boat sunk when trying to land on the coasts of Sicily. The Italian Coastguard have not yet been able to find the boat and only three bodies of the 79 migrants who were travelling on the boat have been found. The Italian Authorities have however arrested the three smugglers who are allegedly responsible for the tragedy and are currently investigating whether it could be possible that the migrants were actually abandoned at sea, which would explain why it has not until now been possible to locate the supposedly-sunken boat. 1 week later it was reported by TGcom that a body washed upon the rocks of Linosa which might have been one of the victims of this shipwreck.Also 2 months later it was reported by ANSA that a body washed ashore on Lampedusa which was probably one of the victims of this shipwreck.

column6: drowned after overcrowded boat from Ahmetbeyli (TR) sank off Aegean coast; 46 survivors
drowned after overcrowded boat from Ahmetbeyli (TR) sank off Aegean coast; 46 survivors
column7: Last week’s sinking of a migrant boat off the Turkish coast took place about 50 metres from shore.  The high death toll of 61 persons, including 31 children and infants, seems to have occurred in part because many of the boat’s passengers were either trapped or locked below the main deck of the boat.  Some media reports describe the boat, the “Sailor”, as a small fishing boat, but pictures of the accident scene suggest that the boat was probably a pleasure boat.  The boat struck underwater rocks causing it to sink on 6 September.  The boat reportedly departed from Ahmetbeyli and had traveled approximately 25 km along the coastline when it sank near the village of Menderes.  The migrants on board included Syrians, Iraqis, and others.  At least 49 survivors were able to swim ashore.  The boat’s Turkish captain and at least one crew member have been arrested and charged with human smuggling and reckless homicide.  The crew reportedly made no efforts to assist the passengers as the boat was sinking.

column6: committed suicide in a refugee centre in Kirchheim (DE) out of despair over living conditions
family of asylum seekers, drowned in shipwreck on way from Latakia (SY) to Karpasia (CY)
column7: A boat carrying Syrians sank off the coast of the Karpas Peninsula  in Northern Cyprus  earlier this week.  Seven people are reported dead, including two children.  Two survivors were reportedly arrested on human smuggling charges.  The boat is reported to have left the Syrian port city of Latakia which is approximately 100 km from the closest parts of Northern Cyprus.

column6: missing, reportedly drowned, after vessel from Tripoli (LY) capsized off Libyan coast
column7: (ANSAMed) - ROME, AUGUST 30 - The Egyptian Navy recovered 10 bodies last night, possibly from a fishing boat full of migrants that capsized between Saturday and Sunday off the eastern coast of Libya, near the border with Egypt, Egyptian daily Al Masri Al Youm reported on Thursday.Monitors from Rome-based NGO Italian Council for Refugees (ICR) said that 33 out of 75 people survived that shipwreck. An ICR delegations visited the survivors, who are being held in a detention center in the Libyan town of Sabrata. The passengers included migrants from Nigeria, Bangladesh, Somalia, Eritrea and Ghana, 11 of them women, survivors said. Just three of the women were rescued. A pregnant woman, whose partner is now at Sabrata, was among the victims.The boat capsized 4 hours after leaving Tripoli, because its fuel cargo was too heavy, the survivors explained. Libyan authorities were only able to rescue 33 people.''The fate of migrants in Libya is very worrisome,'' ICR Director Christopher Hein said recently. ''We want to make it very clear that Libya today lacks the minimum conditions for welcoming and protecting migrants and refugees.'' (ANSAMed).
